name: Cap't Loui - Cajun Seafood Boil
address: 105-02 Rockaway Blvd, Ozone Park, NY 11417, USA

reviews.text: We‚Äôve been coming here for years! They recently added scallops to their menu. Food is always good and seasoned well
I enjoyed my seafood boil, it was quite flavorful. The waitress was really nice and the ambiance was great. Playlist was 10/10.
Food is delicious as always, service is friendly and professional. This restaurant is a great substitute for city island and in many respect even better
The food was delicious we ordered the fisherman platter it was delicious but the service was a bit slow
Love coming here. Live in brooklyn but would travel all the way here. The food is really good. I recommend.

The food was absolutely delicious! Every dish was full of flavor and perfectly prepared. The service was excellent the staff was always helpful, friendly, and very attentive to our needs. Overall, it was a wonderful dining experience, and I can‚Äôt wait to go back!
GREAT FOOD! Super friendly and awesome service, I honestly recommend this place 100000% definitely coming back here again !!!!I love it !
Excellent food and service!!
Great experience every time I come in. The food is so flavorful and well seasoned!! The servers are always so pleasant and attentive. I truly love it here.
FOOD WAS GOOD!! Not salty at all. definitely coming back soon
It's already been three times.
This place is a wonderful place to dine in, I love their services and their food. They are very patient and very nice to us.

My girlfriend mentioned she wanted sea food boil. I‚Äôm like let‚Äôs go somewhere she choose capt loui. And let me tell you guys, they did not disappointttt! From the quick and attentive service to the delicious food I didn‚Äôt even get a chance to take the picture. Great neighborhood spot for good seafood boil. We came here on a tuesday night and it was good!
The food was so tasty! The best snow crab in Queens and the music and atmosphere were on point! Kid friendly also, will definitely come back.
Food was great I drove 40 min for it amazing üî•ü©∑
I loved everything about this place!
Great place to dine w friends & family üëåüëå
This Cajun seafood feast is spicy and flavorful, with lively service and a fun, casual atmosphere‚Äîperfect for a hearty, enjoyable meal!
This place is so good! Staff is very attentive and friendly. Boil was super tasty and seasoned. Will def be back!

The food was great the wait time was short‚Ä¶. Their lobster roll with Cajun fries üòç..,, the boil bag was great mild sauce next time I will try spicy. Lots of shrimpüòçomg the drinks was on point will definitely come back ‚Ä¶ imma get lucky tonight üçÜ
Food was amazing! Came out hot and fresh. Will come back again
My boyfriend and I had decided to check out this restaurant for the first time! 10/10! great service, great food, everything! We will definitely come back here again and again!
Food was good
Great service , food was extremely flavorful and the staff was friendly and helpful, we love this place and recommend to all my friends and family. Good job guys üôèüèº
taste extremely good
AMAZING FOOD I CAME HERE 14 TIMES IN THE PAST 2 MONTHS
the best seafood i‚Äôve ever had!! worth every penny!!
Great and fast service , nice workers and AMAZING food!!! I definitely recommend.
Emily our Serving she is amazing and smiles all the time thank u Emily üôè
Great food great service
The best seafood boils & amazing drinks! I love the lowkey vibes that works with any occasion.

This place is absolutely amazing. We tried the Cajun seafood boil and everything was a 10/10. The food was well seasoned and cook. And the staff were amazing. The funnel cake was also amazing. I tried the Mr. Rich, Strawberry Margarita, and Pina colada. My favorite was the Pina colada. I have no complaints about the food and the service and I definitely will be back!
The food is very delicious and the place is good
This place doesn‚Äôt rush you; the experience unfolds slowly, course by course, like a well-written story.
Food was hot and delicious. Drinks and service a plus.
This has been my favorite seafood spot for a while now! Consistent great flavor and serving amount. Never disappoints! Love it!
The drinks are definitely great I love it the food is on point and so delicious üòãüòã
Drinkss on pointt! Food is amazing definitely 10/10
10/10 I‚Äôve been here twice in about a span of 3-5 months it‚Äôs really good nice workers and amazing sauce
The food was good love they seasoned mussels and they adult pouch drinks absolutely good love the location

Ok this place is actually so good. The seafood boil was on point, seasoned well, not too salty, and the flavor actually stuck to the seafood instead of just sitting in the sauce. Everything tasted fresh. The real winner though is the garlic noodles. They‚Äôre buttery and garlicky in the best way, super simple but just perfect with the boil.

Service was solid, food came out quick, and the whole spot has a good vibe. Definitely a five-star kind of place.

I recently came here with my bestie. We both had oysters, and the 2lb combo with snow crab and shrimp in the medium spicy Cap‚Äôt Loui sauce. It was so delicious!! We also had the Ms.Cutie drink which was top tier.  Food was amazing and service was even better! Alex and Sybil are sweethearts‚ù§Ô∏è I will definitely be back soonüòÅüòÅ

Really enjoyed my visit here! The seafood boil was fresh, tasty, and had a great variety of add-ons at a good price. Our server, Susmita, was so attentive and kind, which made the experience even better. Definitely a spot I‚Äôd come back to!

Our comfort spot! Close to home, never disappoints. 10/10 great service, great food :)
Great vibes as well.

We ordered pick3 and there were 2 pounds of mussels. The shell is so dirty and disgusting. They seems not even clean the seafood before they cook and it's rubbery. I feel like throwing up.  It's unsafe and I will not order any food from them.

I love coming here with my daughter she love her some seafood boil and garlic noodles! The flavor is so impeccable, delicious, scrumptious. We devour them crabs, corn, potatoes , but the sauce give it a taste better then red crabs! 10/10 ‚ùóÔ∏èThey gotten more seats more space parking in front and all around, nice calm place.

Cap‚Äôt Loui is hands down one of the best Cajun seafood boil spots around! The Captain Loui sauce is my absolute favorite ‚Äî rich, flavorful, and perfectly seasoned. I went with the medium spice, which hit that perfect balance of heat while still letting you savor all the delicious flavors.

The seafood portions are generous and fresh, and everything was cooked just right. The staff is friendly and attentive, making the experience even better. The location is clean and comfortable, with a casual, welcoming vibe. There‚Äôs limited free parking in front, which is super convenient if you get there early.

Overall, Cap‚Äôt Loui delivers on flavor, quality, and service ‚Äî definitely a spot I‚Äôll be coming back to!

The environment was clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, which added to the overall pleasant atmosphere. You can tell the staff takes pride in keeping everything spotless.

As for the food‚Äîeverything we ordered was delicious. The ingredients were fresh, the presentation was great, and the flavors were perfectly balanced. But what really stood out to me was the sauce‚Äîit was incredible! Rich, flavorful, and clearly made with care. It tied the whole meal together beautifully.

I went there with my more to have a casual dinner. The restaurant was well lit nice and clean. The food was off the hook one of the best sea food boils I have tried but the star of the show was the warm welcome and hospitality of our servers Shiva and Alex. They really made us feel welcomed. Their hospitality and service was top notch . I too am in the restaurant industry and they are a Jem to have run your place. Amazing experience.

The food was great. We had a table of four. The we ordered the wing basket for an appetizer and it was freshly cooked still steaming. Our seafood boil bags we're well seasoned and tasty. We also got a few drinks that came in Capri pouches. I would recommend Capt Loui on Rockaway Blvd.

I like to share detailed reviews for all. So I dined in. I was greeted and seated immediately. It took the young lady a little while to return, but no big deal.My order was taken accurately & she was friendly. The food came out hot and tasted fresh. The season in the boil bag lacked, it was mainly oil, which I wasn‚Äôt a fan of. I still ate my meal. My problem came at the end when I received my bill. The male waiter wearing glasses returns with my paid check and taps the check and says ‚ÄúTIP‚Äù. My first thought is how did you figure that I wasn‚Äôt going to tip you that you needed to ask. I was appalled. I did tip and was going to but YOU DONT ASK‚Ä¶. If the customer wants to give they will. That was a big no no for me
We got the 4lbs combo and the flavor was amazing! Definitely worth it!

So I‚Äôm not sure if the pounds are actually a pound . The portions seem a bit small. The prices are also high here .

Service was a bit slow but the food was freshly made and hot..

I honestly would not buy the calamari again . Definitely the frozen calamari .

I loved the Jambalaya soup! Next time I will order a bowl instead of a cup. I liked their lobster rolls and my boyfriend has the oysters every time. The fish pieces in the fish and chips were thicc. The servers are really friendly, attentive, and welcoming. The drinks are tasty too. ;)

We got the boiler combo with 3 pounds total with clams shrimps and snow crabs. The capt louie sauce is super tasty and for the side we recommend the lemon pepper fries and sausage (they give lots of pieces of sausage). Overall food is super fitting with the sauce and medium spicy is not that spicy

Hands down one of the best seafood boils I‚Äôve been to. We tried the shrimp head on, the snow crab, mussels and lobster. Everything was done to perfection. Would definitely recommend the snow crab if you‚Äôre willing to work for the meat. Would definitely recommend and can‚Äôt wait to come again

Nice spot for fresh seafood boil. Sauce was a bit on the sweeter side (maybe because it is Korean owned!) but the shrimp and crab were very fresh compared to other seafood boils. I got a shrimp sandwich as well that you could pass, it was good but little shrimp was actually in it.  The service was nice and the waiter was attentive.
5/5 stars! Delicious food, generous portions, eco-friendly atmosphere, and amazing service! We'll definitely be back. Highly recommend Capt. Loui!

Amazing!! Was lucky enough to go when business was slow.  My friend and I shared half a dozen oysters and I ordered the shrimp boil and garlic noodles.  I had never had oysters before, so I didn't know what to expect.  But these tasted fresh and delicious.  Let me tell you -- the reviews recommending the garlic noodles are spot on. It complemented the shrimp boil perfectly.  Chose the Capt Loui's sauce with medium spiciness and it was definitely the right call.  Not to salty, which is what I was worried about.  My friend devoured his clam chowder in a matter of minutes, so I'm guessing he enjoyed it.

This place is super underrated.  I'll definitely be coming back!  So glad to have found a seafood place in the neighborhood.
Super fun experience. Everything is well priced and tastes great!

Delicious food and drinks!
We we ordered the 2 pound meal combo with shrimp, muscle, clams, and got a free side. The food was delicious
For drinks, we had a margarita and the ocean breeze which was perfect!

muscles were not edible what so ever , the sea food boil sauce tasted very very sweet more then savory & the customer service was very bad and all 3 of the servers truly didn‚Äôt know what they were doing. overall not an experience worth having especially with their high prices.

I am a huge seafood boil lover and once captain Loui opened in Queens- I knew I had to check it out!

I‚Äôve dined at the South Ozone location atleast 5 times since they opened and never had a bad experience. I‚Äôve even ordered delivery and the food quality remained high.

The servers were always polite, accommodating, and made me feel very welcomed + did I mention the food is good?!

The restaurant has the expected look of a seafood boil restaurant- food pictures on the wall, fishing gears etc music is usually moderately low and adds to the ambience

Food: I typically opt for the lemon pepper fries, lobster roll, whole Dungeness crab with shrimp head on, corn & rice ( sausage too if it‚Äôs pay day lol)

Currently no happy hour at this location and no outdoor seating. Reservations can be made but I‚Äôve never had an issue with walking in

My only feedback: the cocktail menu needs some work. The Caprisun drinks are a cool concept but the drinks are either lacking flavor, lacking alcohol or both. Other than that, looking forward to returning!

Very tasty. I took out one star because the lobster tail was over cooked and the portions of potatos and corn are too small. No sides with the boil option unless it‚Äôs 2IB. Maybe this is normal in NY, I am visiting from TEXAS.
We had fried calamari, fish and chips, clam chowder soup, 3 boils (shrimp, lobster tail)

Food was amazing, and food top notch! We literally destroyed the food as soon as it got here, and the garlic noodles were that amazing, we had to order a second order üòçüòãüëçüèº
Great and amazing place, would definitely recommend üòÅ
Good customer service. The lobster roll order came with two cold rolls full of celery! The Cajuns fries were cold and yuck. Big mistake. Highly disappointed, no love put into this.

I enjoyed having seafood boil here with some of my girls.
Will definitely be re-revisiting.
Food and vibes are amazing! Super affordable! Fun for a quick date with your spouse or family dinner. Drinks are incredible.

Cho was so sweet and attentive . The food was amazing as usual
And the oysters are to die for !
Thank you Cho !

The soft shell crab basket was great. I didn't like the lemon pepper fries and should have got the regular or Cajun fries instead. It was just under $23 for 3 small crabs and fries. I still wanted more after finishing the 3 crabs due to their size. I think they should offer a 4- piece crab basket and fries for $25 flat. I believe it would sell fast.

Food is good but definitely on the pricey side. Their lobster roll is good but doesn't really have that much meat for the money. The lobster roll was definitely bigger bread wise compared to some of the other lobster rolls that I've had so‚Ä¶

Oysters for $1 on Tuesdays? are you kidding me? And this ain‚Äôt fish bait. These are really good oysters. Everything here is great: the portions, options, sides, mix, and match. Definitely recommend the boiled combos. They are a great deal and always fresh & delicious. You really you can‚Äôt go wrong with anything here. If you happen to come in on a night that ian is working, definitely request him because he‚Äôs a rockstar. So glad the Cap‚Äôt. came to Sunnyside!
The Seafood boil was great . My son also enjoyed his kids meal. Emily and Su were so sweet and took care of my son & I. We will be back <3333
